LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.NumTagsDesc: The number of colonists who have the tag in their loadout
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.ExtraCopiesDesc: The number of extra copies to make
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.ItemRepetitionDesc: The number of items to make per tag
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.CopyPasteExplain: Copy and paste shared attributes in filters between items in Tags
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.SpecifyElementsTool: Specify aspects (stuff, quality, hp) for the thing(s) that this tag-item accepts
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.EditQuantity: Edit the quantity of items which should be held
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.SelectPrevious: Select Previous Pawn ( or press LArrow )
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.SelectNext: Select Next Pawn ( or press RArrow )
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.WeightOverCapacity: The weight of gear carried by the pawn, vs the carry capacity of the pawn
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.CoverageExplanation:
The coverage panel is a visualization of all the 'slots' on a pawn which can be covered by apparel. (currently in your game feels unnecessary)
Each box represents a body part (i.e. torso) and an apparel layer (i.e. onskin). Apparels can cover multiple body parts and span multiple layers. As such, layering clothing can be quite complex and conflict resolution can get complicated quickly.
Boxes are coloured to represent their current status: - Grey: There is no apparel in this loadout which covers this slot. - Red: There are multiple apparels which cover this slot. A semi-transparent apparel will be drawn, showing the highest priority apparel which would cover this slot, and hovering over the slot will show which apparel is blocking it. - Other: The remaining colours used in the visualization represents the tag an apparel is coming from and can be used to cross-reference corresponding layers with the primary tag.
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.MassChangeStates: Change all pawns loadout-states in {0}'s {1} to {2}
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.StatesExplanation:
Loadout states are used for swapping between tags immediately after an action by a player, without modifying a pawns loadout. You are able to enable or disable certain tags in a pawns loadout depending on which state the pawn currently has active.
Right click a button in the below column to mass assign all pawns on the same Map/Caravan as the selected pawn to the same loadout state (this is useful for mass-assignment to states you may create such as 'War' when a raid is fired on a particular map).
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.SatisfyLoadoutNowFa: {0} is already attempting to satisfy loadout
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.CouldNotFindPawn: could not find a pawn to select
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.InvalidStateName: Can not create a loadout state with an empty identifier
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.SearchBarDesc: Search by item name, mod name, stat bonus names, or the apparel layer the item covers
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.OutfitDisallowsKit: {0}'s outfit {1} will prevent them from equipping {2} added by the tag {3}
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.PanicStateDesc: Adds the ability to immediately swap all pawns on the current map to a particular state determined ahead of time (here). This can be toggled on/off, pawns will default back to the state they had active prior to the panic state being activated.
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.NoValidPanicStates: There are no other states which could be used as the panic state
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.CantOverridePanicMo: Can not set state of pawn currently in panic mode
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.PanicStateAlertDesc: There are colonists which are in an active panic state, meaning they have the {0} state active.
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.ActivatePanicState: Enable panic state in all pawns, this will switch all pawns temporarily to the {0} state, until toggled off, where their previous state will be reinstated.
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.DeactivatePanicStat: Disable panic state, restoring all colonists loadout state to the state they were in prior to the panic state being activated.
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.LoadTagDialogue: Load tag "{0}" into your game as "{1}"
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.TagAlreadyRegistere: a tag has already been {0} with that name
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.WarnNoPanicStateLoa: No loadout state has been set as the state to default to when pawns are in their panic state.
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.WarningItemDependsO: If this item is loaded into a save without these mods it will drop these items automatically from the tag automatically, without removing them from the saved tag.
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.WarningItemFilterDe: If this item is loaded into a save without these mods it will drop these items automatically from the filter automatically, without removing them from the saved tag.
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.WarningItemDependsO: This item will be dropped from the tag, its mod is most likely not loaded.
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.WarningItemFilterDe: This item will be dropped from the filter automatically, its mod is most likely not loaded.
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.ResearchedItemsDesc: Filter only to show things which have already been researched (hide non-researched things)
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.SortThingsByDesc: Choose an attribute to sort the things listed by, right click to specify what attribute, left click to switch between ascending/descending
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.EquippedStatOffsets: Stat bonuses which will be applied when the items in this loadout are equipped
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.EnableTagByDefaultD: New pawns which join your colony will have this tag added automatically
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.AutomaticBillToolti: Automatically create bills for all tags on pawns on the current map
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.ApparelOverlapFlavo: If equipped, {0} would prevent the highlighted apparel being worn
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.Settings.InterGameT: must be in game if you intend to load tags to and from a save
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.Settings.Immediatel: Pawns will immediately attempt to update their loadout any time it has changed (tag removed from loadout, current loadoutstate changed, etc)
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.Settings.BiasLoadBe: Pawns will prioritise wearing items which add mass. warning: this may override tag preference
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.Settings.OnlyLoadou: Only wear items found in loadout
Pawns will only wear apparel which is found in the active tags of their loadout.
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.Settings.HideGizmoD: Prevents the gizmo from being rendered
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.Settings.DisableCus: Disable custom cursor when dragging, may fix linux issues
It may fix issues relating to perpetually inivisble mouses on linux platforms.
LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.Settings.NoPanicAle: Disable the check to raise an alert when there are pawns with their panic state active.
